Line 145: Line 145:
==ShipIt==
==ShipIt==
â
Canonical offers Ubuntu installation CDs/dvd at no cost, including paid postage for destinations in most countries around the world, via a service called ShipIt.<ref name="ubushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.ubuntu.com/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Ubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-04-26}}</ref> After a request for CDs is made and approved, disks are sent to the user's postal address in the mail at no charge. Delivery is estimated at six to ten weeks.<ref name="shipit">{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/shipit-faq | title=ShipIt Questions | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
+
Canonical offers Ubuntu installation CDs at no cost, including paid postage for destinations in most countries around the world, via a service called ShipIt.<ref name="ubushipi">{{cite web | url=https://shipit.ubuntu.com/ | title=Shipit - free shipment of Ubuntu CDs | accessdate=2006-04-26}}</ref> After a request for CDs is made and approved, disks are sent to the user's postal address in the mail at no charge. Delivery is estimated at six to ten weeks.<ref name="shipit">{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/shipit-faq | title=ShipIt Questions | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
â
Only the most recent version of Ubuntu - and variants Kubuntu and Edubuntu - is offered for free via ShipIt. Other variants and earlier versions are available for Internet download, but not via ShipIt.<ref name="shipit">{{cite web | url=http://wwwubuntu.com/getubuntu/shipit-faq | title=ShipIt Questions accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
+
Only the most recent version of Ubuntu - and variants Kubuntu and Edubuntu - is offered for free via ShipIt. Other variants and earlier versions are available for Internet download, but not via ShipIt.<ref name="shipit">{{cite web | url=http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/shipit-faq | title=ShipIt Questions | accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref>
